|Title=Knowing the additional examinations to be carried out urgently in cardiogenic PAO
|Description=Know how to order: ECG, arterial GDS, chest X-ray, biological work-up, indication for natriuretic peptide assay, troponin, echocardiography, etc.
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=Olivier Huttin
|Order=11}}
None of these additional tests should delay patient management.


- Blood tests: blood ionogram (Na+,K+), urea, creatinine, CBC, liver function tests

- Troponin, especially in cases of chest pain and ECG changes

- BNP or NT Pro BNP

- ECG

- Chest X-ray

- Arterial blood gas

- Cardiac ultrasound

question.title: What additional tests should be urgently carried out in cardiogenic PAO to inform patient management?
question.description: Know how to order the following tests: ECG, arterial GDS, chest X-ray, biological work-up, indication for natriuretic peptide assay, troponin, echocardiography, etc.

option_a.title: Blood tests: blood ionogram (Na+,K+), urea, creatinine, CBC, liver function tests, troponin
option_a.description: A comprehensive set of blood tests to evaluate electrolyte imbalances and liver function

option_b.title: Blood tests: blood ionogram (Na+,K+), urea, creatinine, CBC, liver function tests, BNP or NT Pro BNP
option_b.description: A set of blood tests to evaluate electrolyte imbalances, liver function, and cardiac biomarkers

option_c.title: Blood tests: blood ionogram (Na+,K+), urea, creatinine, CBC, liver function tests, ECG
option_c.description: A set of blood tests to evaluate electrolyte imbalances, liver function, and cardiac electrical activity

option_d.title: Blood tests: blood ionogram (Na+,K+), urea, creatinine, CBC, liver function tests, chest X-ray
option_d.description: A set of blood tests to evaluate electrolyte imbalances, liver function, and chest imaging
